segments.text: You think debugging JSON is just part of
the job? Endless scrolling, brackets
inside brackets, trying to figure out
where things went wrong. But what if the
problem isn't the JSON? It's the way
you've been looking at it. This is JSON
crack. Yeah, you heard that right. And
if you've ever opened a huge JSON file
and instantly felt lost, this might
completely change how you work. In the
next few minutes, we're going to look at
what this is, why it's blowing up on
GitHub with over 40,000 stars, and why
so many devs are switching to it. We
have videos coming out all the time. Be
sure to subscribe.
You probably expect a JSON tool to just
clean things up and make it look pretty.
Indent, color it, call it a day. That's
not what JSON crack does. Instead of
forcing us to read JSON as text, it
turns JSON, YAML, XML, and even CSV into
interactive graphs. You don't just look
at your data anymore. We can actually
explore it a lot faster. You've heard
why this matters, but just in case you
missed it, it's because in an API heavy
data world where scrolling wastes time,
visualizing shows structure instantly.
It runs fully on your machine for
privacy, works in VS Code, and helps you
understand complex data faster. If you
touch messy data regularly, this is
going to save you a lot of time. Now,
talking about it only gets us so far.
Let's actually see it. Go to the JSON
crack editor. Paste in your data. And
this is where things get interesting.
You'd expect it to just sit there
looking pretty. But watch what happens
next before you go any further. Right
away, that messy JSON turns into a
clean, readable, clickable graph. This
is insane. Instead of scrolling, you can
expand nodes. Instead of guessing, you
hover and see exactly what's inside. And
instead of hunting for what you're
looking for, it shows us those keys
instantly. And yeah, I know some of you
are going to ask, is there a dark mode?
Yeah, there's a dark mode. Do you need
TypeScript types? Yeah, in just one
click. Made a mistake in your JSON? It
flags these errors clearly with no
guessing. I can even switch formats
instantly from JSON to YAML, JSON to CSV
without any extra tools and the graphs
change with it. Even with massive files
packed with thousands of nodes, it stays
smooth. And the best part, your data
never leaves your device. Nothing gets
sent to a server. It stays right here.
This is somewhat feels like cheating,
but this tool is an incredible hack. At
first, it appears to just be for quick
visual checks, but it goes further. JSON
crack actually integrates directly into
VS Code and Jet Brain, so it fits into
your normal workflow. You can decode
JWTs, run JQ queries, generate mock data
for testing. Now, there is a premium
version with extra features, but
everything you're seeing here right now
is completely free. Compared to plain
text editors, this kind of visualization
makes patterns jump out, which helps cuz
there is a lot we'd completely miss.
It's being used daily to debug massive
responses, explain data structures, and
untangle complex configs faster. If you
work with APIs, web apps, or data
pipelines, this isn't just nice to have.
It's a real productivity boost. JSON
Crack is simple, it's powerful, and it,
for the most part, is completely free.
If this helped you, subscribe for more
tools that actually make your
development easier. We'll see you in
another
